page.title: 01TOWYN AND KINMEL BAY.
page.content:
Two large villages on the{NORTH WALES {COAST}near the town of{RHYL}in the county of{CLWYD.}The area is a tourist centre,catering for holidaymakers from Cheshire,Lancashire,Yorkshire and the Midlands.It is also a popular retirement area.Before the 1930's there was little settlement.The{1874 {ORDNANCE SURVEY}shows 17 farms,only 3 now remain as working farms,the others having disappeared,or become holiday centres.Two{TILERIES}shown on the 1874 Survey have also ceased to exist in their original form To the south of the designated block is part of the site of the{BATTLE OF {MORFA RHUDDLAN}which took place in AD 795,when the Saxons massacred the Welsh.
.
